metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36055 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
XMP Toolkit SDK versions 2020.1 (and earlier) are affected by ause-after-free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code executionin the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requiresuser interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exempi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1').
